meanings.definition: A broom or brush used for sweeping.
meanings.sent1: I used the walis to clean the floor.
meanings.sent2: Mom bought a new walis for the house.
meanings.sent3: The walis danced across the floor as I swept.
meanings.sent4: The walis worked tirelessly, sweeping away the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The walis stood in the corner, ready for action.

meanings.definition: To sweep with a broom or brush.
meanings.sent1: I will walis the leaves off the porch.
meanings.sent2: She walis the kitchen every morning.
meanings.sent3: The wind seemed to walis the fallen leaves away.
meanings.sent4: He walis the problems under the rug instead of facing them.
meanings.sent5: The janitor walis the hallway with precision and care.
